results.title: Laws of heredity
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows how inheritance is determined in statistically predictable ways. Presents the insights and conclusions about inheritance that were first discovered by Gregor Mendel. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Last of the windjammers
results.creator_credit: Athol Emerton and New England Film Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the departure from Newcastle of the barque Lawhill, one of the last of the square riggers to visit Australia. With a background of sea chanties, the scenes of the unfurling of the great sails of the stately vessel convey a vivid impression of the days of the windjammers.

results.title: Last hour clash (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Agency for Instructional Television and Exxon Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Heart of Teaching”.
Considers frustration’s teachers feel when they are unable to reach certain students. Shows a few ways teachers may deal with those frustration’s.

results.title: Lasers: an introduction
results.brief_description: Principles of laser operation are illustrated, including concepts of coherent and incoherent light, continuous and discrete spectra, stimulation of atoms, and resonance. Gaseous and crystalline lasers are shown to be valuable tools of holography, communications, medicine and industry.

results.title: The Language of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the history and development of the language of Japan, in both spoken and written forms. Defines and illustrates Japanese literary traditions, and shows the highly refined art form of calligraphy.

results.title: Language of drawing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film attempts to provide a sensible and acceptable answer to the question: “Why study mechanical drawing?” and to stimulate the beginning of students’ interest in the subject.

results.title: The Land of lots of time
results.brief_description: A fascinating trip from the Murray Gulf to the S.W. of N.S.W. with Graham Pizzey, well known naturalist. The emphasis is on how wildlife adapts to habitat.

results.title: Lamb for world market
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: A thriving industry in Western Australia is the production of lambs for the meat export trade. These lambs, which are slaughtered at 16 weeks, are specially bred for the purpose. They are yarded and sent to Fremantle. Great care is taken to prevent injury. After slaughtering, the carcases are carefully inspected, then graded and passed through various processes until they reach the freezing chamber. From there they are taken as expeditiously as possible to the ships which transport them to the United Kingdom, USA, Canada and Hong Kong.

results.title: Lady Baden Powell in Victoria, 1967
results.brief_description: Lady Baden Powell was the guest of Sir Rohan and Lady Delacombe on this her 5th visit to Australia. Shows enthusiastic receptions at Britannia Park Guide Training Centre, a social at the Exhibition Buildings, a luncheon at Rotary Headquarters, and Festival of Friendship at Festival Hall. Functions were attended by Scouts, Rangers, Guides and Brownies from all over the State. Photography by Betty Reynolds.

results.title: Kyomi from Japan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
The story of Kyomi and her dream of becoming an “Ama” girl. Shows Japanese girls diving for oysters on the Mikimoto farm. When the nucleus is inserted the oysters are placed in wire cages and returned to the water on suspended rafts. They are lifted and cleaned several times before the pearls are harvested. Shows grading, weighing and stringing in the factory.
